item.title: Smerge, ediff and diff
item.description: First published: 2021-04-30 For enditing conflict in git, use smerge or ediff. Smerge Basic workflow: Open magit status with SPC g g in Doom Identify the mark with Unmerged under Unstage list Go to the file and press Enter to open the file The base command for Smerge is C-c ^ You will see the conflict and selecting the upper with C-c ^ u and lower with C-c ^ l To select all ‘conflicting’ changes press C-c ^ a To navigate the conflicts use C-c ^ n and C-c ^ p for next and previous conflict To see all the keybindings use C-c ^ h With DOOM and hydra:

item.title: MS Access Shutdown
item.description: How to shutdown all running Access when you need to do some changes. This is just a summary from Microsoft Docs. The steps are: Create empty text file This file will be the key. Name the file to anything like checkfile.

item.title: Merge Selected File
item.description: This guide is from StackOverflow on how to selectively merge files form one branch to another. Basically it’s: git merge --no-ff --no-commit dev Where dev is the branch you want to merge from into the current branch. The --no-commit option will stage the files that have been merged by Git without actually committing them.

item.title: Doom tips
item.description: First published date: 2021-04-27 Some tips to learn the keybindings in Doom and Evil in the process of migrating from my vanilla Emacs settings. For overview of keybindings type SPC-h-b-b. Other good references: Narra’s Blog - Doom Tips and Howtos Org Mode Shortcuts for Emacs Doom Gist of Hjertnes Evil-mode collection Doom leader-key is SPC and localleader-key is SPC-m.

item.title: data.table special symbol
item.description: .N Mult .SD dan .SDcols .I .GRP dan rleid Contoh dari manual First published: 2017-08-31 Hari ni bersempena Hari kemerdekaan Malaysia ada masa untuk ulang kaji pakej data.table. Hari ni ialah mengenai Special Symbol seperti .N, .I, .GRP, .

item.title: data.table tips
item.description: First published: 2021-04-20 Some tips for data.table that I came across while googling which might be useful. Print To print more rows that default can be done with either: options(datatable.print.topn = 70) print(DT, topn = 70) Using options will implement the changes globally.

item.title: names attribute
item.description: Sometime an object has attribute names for identification of the value with names instead of index. There are time you need to extract the names of a vector or object. The easiest way is to do: library(data.table) dt <- cars[1,] setDT(dt) str(dt) dt[, dist := as.

item.title: SSH-key with Git on Windows
item.description: First published: 2020-09-29 Generally, these are what I did: Install git-with-openssh Create SSH-key Add SSH-key to ssh-agent Create ~/.bashrc for auto-launching ssh-agent Common problems Unable to push to origin with this error message. ssh: Could not resolve hostname personal: Name or service not known fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

item.title: Git Rebase or Reset
item.description: First published: 2021-08-05 Rebase to previous commit of a sepcific branch ie. master. git reset --hard origin/master git status or reset to any previous specific commit. git log --oneline --graph -5 git reset --hard <commit id> git push origin HEAD --force The steps above:

item.title: Clean attributes
item.description: When reading data from SPSS or Stata into R, the metadata will also be inherited to the dataset. Sometimes it can be useful for extra information, but most of the time it’s not needed. To get rid of these metadata then do this:
